page.title: 11ATTITUDES in HOUSTON
page.content: Since Houston consists of an old area and many new housing areas,the community is a varied one.In new estates like Craigends, the population is mainly young, often newly married couples who have rising incomes, children of primary school age and a need for many services. This contrasts with the older more traditional population of the old village. New building in the conservation area is restricted so there is less influx of 'incomers'. There may be some resentment among older people about rapid change, but this is offset by hope of improved services and by some revitalization in the area. The matters of local concern differ according to age,needs and location in the area. There is a thriving community council and parent teacher association .
